title: In Focus Indian Tourism Boom
text:
In Focus Indian Tourism Boom In Focus Indian Tourism Boom 0 
World over, our glorious motherland that is India, is known for its endless and ubiquitous diversity. Being the vibrant nation that it is, India has long since attracted people from across the globe -not to mention the rise in the number of Indian travelling within the country itself. So it comes as no surprise that since times immemorial, India has been a global destination of choice. Despite the infamous poverty and every other negative element that's often brought too into focus, the flipside of India's offerings have always attracted a number of tourists. As a result, tourism has always been amongst the most profitable and successful industries in India. 
Therefore, tourism has played an integral role in not only a cultural export of the country, but also in contributing hugely to the growth of the Indian economy. A number of factors come into play when assessing the prosperity of India's travel and tourism industry. 
To begin with is the bourgeoning middle class. With the growth of the Indian economy, the middle class has witnessed much prosperity. As a result, the disposable income at the hands of the middle class has risen -leading to an augmentation within domestic travels. Moreover, attending a hotel management college has also become a trend among a certain section in society -meeting the rising demands of the travel and tourism industry with equal amounts of supply. 
Both central and state governments have come to understand the importance of tourism to the country's economy -and therefore we see a boom not only in the number of tourists visiting India, but also the spread of a career in tourism becoming a preferring choice amongst many. State governments across the country have dedicated bodies that handle and propagate tourism. In addition, the central government also words towards furthering the agenda of Indian tourism globally, and domestically. 
Another factor that attracts tourists to the country is the rising IT industry and the scope for outsourcing work to India. Additionally, medical tourism has become a major reason for the recent augmentation in tourism in India. With the best-in-class facilities available at lower prices as a result of currency conversions and such, India has become the penultimate medical tourism destination across the globe. 
Now, not only had the tourism industry witnessed a boom in India, but as a result, various other industries within the country have also seen growth. Not to mention the growing number of tourism-related institutions as a result of an increment in the number of people seeking a career in tourism. The other industries include horticulture, handicrafts, construction, IT, medicine etc. In this article Rahul Bakshi is telling a about the growth of career in tourism industry in India.Moreover, attending a hotel management college has also become a trend among a certain section in society.
